byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise reported from Washington, and Anemona Hartocollis from New York.
byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS

abstract: New Jersey man who had recently traveled to Liberia and was under watch by local health authorities for Ebola, dies of Lassa fever after being sent home from hospital where he had been examined for fever and tiredness; incident sheds light on shortcomings of system designed to identify cases of infectious diseases entering United States.
lead_paragraph: The patient had recently returned from Liberia, where the disease is common. It is similar to Ebola, but less deadly.

headline.main: New Jersey Lassa Fever Death Prompts C.D.C. Action
headline.print_headline: Monitoring System Is Criticized as a Rare Virus Kills One Man in New Jersey

snippet: The patient had recently returned from Liberia, where the disease is common. It is similar to Ebola, but less deadly.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
